meanings.definition: An accusation made in response to an accusation made against oneself.
meanings.sent1: After the accusation, she made a countercharge against him.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer prepared a countercharge to defend his client.
meanings.sent3: The countercharge in the courtroom added an unexpected twist to the case.
meanings.sent4: Her countercharge was like a shield against the initial accusation.
meanings.sent5: The countercharge was a powerful tool in the legal battle.

meanings.definition: To make an accusation in response to an accusation made against oneself.
meanings.sent1: He decided to countercharge his opponent in the debate.
meanings.sent2: She countercharged the false claims with evidence.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully countercharged each other for fun.
meanings.sent4: Countercharging in a calm manner can resolve misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The company had to countercharge the competitor's allegations quickly.
